intro: Ptilochaeta elegans, commonly known as the elegant hairtail, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its common name. Ptilochaeta elegans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
